description: Gorillas live in family groups of usually five to 10, but sometimes two to more than 50, led by a dominant adult male—or silverback—who holds his position for years. The bond between the silverback and his females forms the basis of gorilla social life.

image.description: Photo of a Gorilla Walking on Grass by David Atkins (Pexels)

model.description: Silverback Gorilla Figurine by Tyler Jackson (Sketchfab)
